shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 2r-181rb) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 2r-142v) I-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 142v-157v) I-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 157v-166r) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 166ra-176vb) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 176vb-181rb)
Additio 1.

txstates.txstate: Both wooden boards are broken and crudely repaired with different types of threads. There is a hole in the middle of the back board. The tooled leather cover is for the most part torn off (preserved only as turn-ins on the inner side of both boards). The lower corners and the edges are damaged by rodents. Many fols. are stained with water and wax. Holes on fols. 1, 117. Holes are amended on fols. 2, 6, 28, 39, 54, 56, 72, 108.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (both broken and crudely repaired). The leather cover is missing; remains of the turn-ins are visible on the inner face of both boards. Remains of a textile inlay on the inner side of the front board. Two pairs of sewing stations (quires XII-XIV are sewn on one station).

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover is visible on the turn-ins (2 tools were used: double line fillet, single circle).

bnothers.bnother: Holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, one close to the head and two close to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: I(9; s.l.: 1, stub after 8/fols. 1r-9v) – II(8/fols. 10r-17v) – III(8/fols. 18r-25v) – IV(8/fols. 26r-33v) – V(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 3; 6, stub after 2/fols. 34r-41v) – VI(8/fols. 42r-49v) – VII(8/fols. 50r-57v) – VIII(8/fols. 58r-65v) – IX(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 66r-73v) – X(8/fols. 74r-81v) – XI(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6 stub after 2/fols. 82r-89v) – XII(8/fols. 90r-97v) – XIII(8/fols. 98r-105v) – XIV(8; s.l.: 4, stub after 5; 5, stub after 4/fols. 106r-113v) – XV(8/fols. 114r-121v) – XVI(8; s.l.: 4, stub after 5; 5 stub after 4/fols. 122r-129v) – XVII(8/fols. 130r-137v) – XVIII(8/fols. 138r-145v) – XIX(8/fols. 146r-153v) – XX (8/fols. 154r-161v) – XXI (8/fols. 162r-169v) – XXII(8/fols. 170r-177v) – XXIII(5; s.l.: 1, stub after 4; 2, stub after 4; 5, stub after 1/fols. 178r-182v).

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data for fol. 3r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4, I-5: all data for fol. 167r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting tends to upright (nearly left-sloping); broadly spaced and slightly angular letters. Texts I-4 and I-5 are written in smaller letters than the remaining texts.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra (name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5); titles and numbers of the Pss. and Canticles; numbers of Songs; title of Texts I-2, I-3; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; title of Text I-5; name of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; doxology at the end of each Song; elements of the punctuation signs. A few lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Texts I-1 and I-5.

abbreviations.abbreviation: Text I-1 እ᎓ for እስመ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ ምሕረቱ᎓ (Ps. 135, fols. 130r-131r) Text I-2 ስ᎓ for ስቡሕኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ወልዑልኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ (Canticle 10, fol. 153r-v) Text I-4 ሰ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. ሠ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 166rb-167ra) እ᎓/እስ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 167rb-168va) ኵ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 169ra-170rb) ና፡/ናዓ፡ for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 170va-172va) ተ፡/ተፈ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 174ra-175ra) ወ፡/ወበ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 175vb-176va) Text I-5 ወ፤ ሣ፤ ይ፤ ሰ፤ ቅ፤ for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፍለነ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት The abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. ወ፡/ወበ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 178ra-180vb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - With the exception of the letter ʾalef, the traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118 is missing.

additional.cont: Fol. 181v: Excerpt from the prayer Barəkännä ˀəgziˀənä... “Bless us Our Lord...” and an offering prayer over the bread and wine.
additional.det: The prayer is written in the same well-trained hand as the corrections.

extras.extra: - The Pss. are divided into groups of ten or thirty separated by a crude zigzag, drawn in pencil. Also, a zigzag occurs at the beginning of Text I-2. - Indication concerning the special occasions when Ps. 3 could be read: ሶበ፡ ትፈቱ፡ ሢመተ፡ አንብብ፡ ለርእሰከ፡ is written, in a secondary hand, in ink, on fol. 3r. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the whole line: fols. 123v, 124v, 125r, 126rv, 132r, 138r. - Part of the line is taken up: e.g., fols. 9r, 34r, 52r, 64v, 72r, 78v, 81v, 87v, 91r, 97v, 99v, 145v, 150r, 157r, 163v, 165v. - Part of the line is taken down: e.g., fols. 37r, 39r, 46v, 64r, 78r, 81r, 100v, 101v. - Tämälläs-sign, in the shape of a cross, indicating the place where the omission, written in the upper margin, belongs: fol. 56v l.10. - Numerous corrections written over erasures, most probably in a secondary hand: e.g., fols. 5r, 15r, 20r, 34v, 53v, 65r, 81v, 90v, 109v, 121v, 152v. - Erasures marked with two or three lines: e.g., fols. 9v, 14v, 21v, 24r, 37r, 57v, 60v, 79r, 88v, 133r. - Line or several lines of a text have been rubbed out: fols. 152r-153v, 161v, 176ra, 177rb. - A few lines of Ps. 1 are written on fol. 1r. - A few lines from the offering prayer (s. Additio 1) and a legend for the drawing written twice; written upside down: fol. 182r. - Title of the Ps. written in a secondary hand: fols. 10v, 40v. - Words መዝሙር ፱ and መዝሙር፲ written in red pen: fols. 7r, 9r. - Scribbles and doodles, in pen and pencil: fols. 1r, 2r, 4r, 4v, 13v, 14r, 20v, 21r, 22v, 25v, 33r, 42v, 60v, 107v, 125v, 137v, 138v, 170v, 175v, 176r, 176v, 177r, 178v, 179r, 180r, 181v, 182v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Daily readings of Text I-2 are indicated by the days of the week written in the upper margin, in pen: fols. 156r, 156v, 157r. - Daily readings of Text I-4 are indicated by the days of the week crudely written in the upper margin, in pen: fols. 166v, 168v, 170v, 172v, 173v, 174v. - A red thread is inserted in the upper margin of fols. 96, 124, 142.

drawing.info: Fol. 182r: Christ blessing the bread offered by his disciple.
drawing.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ባረከ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኅብስተ፡ ለአርዳኢሁ "How Our Lord blesses the bread of his disciple" The fol. is inserted upside down.
